intro: Cyrtandra engleri, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Cyrtandra engleri is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture.
